oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Poets and Prophets program - Jerry Chesnut - 2009-09-26
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Poets and Prophets interview program and performance with singer/songwriter Jerry Chesnut from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on September 26, 2009.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Jerry Chesnut;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Program begins in progress. Hosted by Michael Gray. Includes performances. Includes selected audio excerpts and audio from video. Subjects include; Inspiration for the song They Don't Make 'em Like My Daddy -- Childhood days in Harlan County, Kentucky -- Musical inspirations and listening to the radio -- Joining the Air Force -- Playing music in the Air Force -- Beginnings of his songwriting career -- Discharge from the Air Force and moving to Florida -- Inspiration for writing the song Oney -- Moving to Nashville -- First time hearing a song of his being sung by Arthur Alexander in a recording session -- Being laid up for 6 months in bed and spending his time listening to country songs to help improve his craft -- Writing the song A Dime At A Time -- Writing the song Another Place, Another Time and how it got to Jerry Lee Lewis -- Writing the song Holding On To Nothing -- Writing the song A Good Year For The Roses and how it got to George Jones --

Writing the song The Wonders You Perform and how it got to Tammy Wynette -- Talks about Elvis Costello's recording of A Good Year For The Roses -- Writing the song It's Four In The Morning and playing it for Faron Young -- Talks about the craft of songwriting -- Hiring Lamar Fike and meeting Elvis Presley -- Writing the song Trouble -- Little David Wilkins -- Performances includes; It's Four In The Morning -- A Good Day For The Roses -- Closing comments.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Chesnut, Jerry; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
